title: Barjora (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
text:
Barjora (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is an <a href="Vidhan%20Sabha">assembly</a> constituency in <a href="Bankura%20district">Bankura district</a> in the <a href="India">India</a>n <a href="States%20and%20territories%20of%20India">state</a> of <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>.
Overview.
As per orders of the Delimitation Commission, No. 253 Barjora (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is composed of the following: <a href="Barjora%20%28Community%20development%20block%29">Barjora</a> <a href="community%20Development%20Block%20in%20India">community development block</a>; and Bhaktabandh, Gangajalghati, Gobindadham, Kapista, Nityanandapur and Piraboni <a href="gram%20panchayat">gram panchayat</a>s of <a href="Gangajalghati%20%28community%20development%20block%29">Gangajalghati</a> community development block.
Barjora (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is part of No. 37 <a href="Bishnupur%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Bishnupur (Lok Sabha constituency)</a>.
Election results.
1977-2006.
In the <a href="2006%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">2006</a>, 2001 and 1996 state assembly elections, Susmita Biswas of <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20India%20%28Marxist%29">CPI(M)</a> won the Barjora seat defeating Shampa Daripa of <a href="All%20India%20Trinamool%20Congress">Trinamool Congress</a>, Sudhansu Sekhar Tewari of Trinamool Congress and Tapasi Banerjee of <a href="Indian%20National%20Congress">Congress</a> respectively. Contests in most years were multi cornered but only winners and runners are being mentioned. Jayasri Mitra of CPI(M) defeated Sabyasachi Roy of Congress in 1991 and Sudhansu Sekhar Tewari of Congress in 1987. <a href="Lalbihari%20Bhattacharya">Lalbihari Bhattacharya</a> of CPI(M) defeated Sudhansu Sekhar Tewari of Congress in 1982. Aswini Kumar Raj of CPI(M) defeated Sudhansu Sekhar Tewari of Congress in 1977.
1952-1972.
Sudhansu Sekhar Tewary of Congress won in 1972. Aswini Kumar Raj of CPI(M) won in 1971 and 1969. A.Chatterjee of Congress won in 1967. Pramatha Ghosh of <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20India">CPI</a> won in <a href="1962%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">1962</a>. The Barjora seat was not there in <a href="1957%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">1957</a>. Prafulla Chandra Roy of Congress won the Barjora seat in <a href="1952%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">independent India's first election in 1952</a>.
